title: Consolidate duplicate documentation
description:
Consolidate multiple documents covering the same topics into single comprehensive guides. Reduces duplication and creates canonical references.

## Rationale

Currently have 4+ docs on labels/hierarchy and 3+ docs for agent usage. Creates confusion and maintenance burden. Consolidate into single authoritative sources.

## Acceptance Criteria

### 1. Consolidate Label Documentation → docs/guides/labels.md

Merge into single comprehensive guide:
- label-conventions.md (684 lines)
- label-quick-reference.md
- dependency-vs-labels-clarity.md
- Extract current behavior summary from archived type-hierarchy docs

Content should include:
- Label format and namespace rules
- Type hierarchy usage (milestone, epic, task, etc.)
- Strategic vs tactical classification
- Dependency vs label distinction
- Agent usage patterns
- Quick reference section
- Configuration examples

Use  for main source file to preserve history.

### 2. Consolidate Agent Documentation → Enhanced AGENT-QUICKSTART.md

Integrate into single comprehensive agent guide:
- agent-context-mcp.md (449 lines)
- agent-project-initialization-guide.md (621 lines)
- getting-started-complete.md (915 lines)

Add missing content:
- Gate workflow examples
- Documentation lifecycle usage
- MCP tool reference

Use  for main file to preserve history.

### 3. Remove Obsolete Speculative Docs

Remove future features that should be tracked as issues:
- auth-design.md (create future issue if needed)
- billing-design.md (create future issue if needed)

### 4. Update References

- Find and update all internal references to consolidated/removed docs
- Update README.md links
- Verify all cross-references work

## Success Metrics

- 4+ label docs → 1 comprehensive guide
- 3+ agent docs → 1 comprehensive guide
- No duplicate content
- All references updated
- Git history preserved
